Class SolveFringeElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • SolveFringeElement

  • public class SolveFringeElement
extends java.lang.Object

    A SolveFringeElement instance serves as an element in a SolveFringe. Its main purpose is to keep track of the moves that led the search process to the Tray specified by this class's d Tray instance variable.

    The references of a SolveFringeElement instance, once created, are immutable.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Point newBlockPosition
      Reperesents the position of the Block that has just been moved in this element's Tray configuration.
      Point oldBlockPosition
      Represents the position of the Block that has just been moved in the parent element's Tray configuration.
      private static java.util.Stack<java.lang.String> outputStack
      This stack is used to reverse the order of moves that printMoveTraceHelper has searched through.
      SolveFringeElement parent
      Represents the other element that the search process was at right before this configuration.
      Tray tray
      Represents the current Tray configuration that the search process is at.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int printMoveTrace()
      Prints the series of moves that led the search process from its initial Tray to this configuration, in the order starting from the initial Tray and ending at this Tray.
      private static void printMoveTraceHelper(SolveFringeElement root)
      Adds the given argument's move string (as specified in printMoveTrace()), to the outputStack, and then iteratively does the same thing on the root's parent if any, then on the root's grandparent if any, and so on.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SolveFringeElement

        public SolveFringeElement(Tray tray,
                  SolveFringeElement parent,
                  Point oldBlockPosition,
                  Point newBlockPosition)
        Creates a new SolveFringeElement with the given arguments. All the references set by the arguments are thereby immutable. Set parent, oldBlockPosition and newBlockPosition to null if this element is the root of a fringe. However, the tray argument should never be null.
        Parameters:
        tray - - the current Tray configuration that the search process is at
        parent - - the other element that the search process was at right before this configuration
        oldBlockPosition - - the position of the Block that has just been moved in the parent element's Tray configuration
        newBlockPosition - - the position of the Block that has just been moved in this element's Tray configuration
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - when tray is null

    • Method Detail

      • printMoveTrace

        public int printMoveTrace()

        Prints the series of moves that led the search process from its initial Tray to this configuration, in the order starting from the initial Tray and ending at this Tray.

        Each line contains four digits and corresponds to a single move. The first two digits represent the row/column indices of the moving Block before the move. The last two digits represent the row/column indices of the moving Block after the move.

        This method also returns an integer value that counts all the parents of this element and the element itself (this element, direct parent, grandparent, grand-grandparent, and so on).

        Returns:
        the number of parents of this element

      • printMoveTraceHelper

        private static void printMoveTraceHelper(SolveFringeElement root)
        Adds the given argument's move string (as specified in printMoveTrace()), to the outputStack, and then iteratively does the same thing on the root's parent if any, then on the root's grandparent if any, and so on. If root==null, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        root - - the element to start the addition process at
